body: For posts that allude to the [[Saturday Night Live]] sketch "The Roxbury Guys":[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Recurring_Saturday_Night_Live_characters_and_sketches_introduced_1995%E2%80%9396&oldid=1242062561#The_Roxbury_Guys] featuring "Will Ferrell":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_Ferrell], Chris Kattan, and "Jim Carrey":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Carrey] (or other host) in which the characters want to go clubbing at the popular night spot The Roxbury, but are constantly denied entry. title: troll
body:
A race of fearsome creatures from [[Norse mythology]].

Originally more or less the Nordic equivalents of [[giant]]s, although often smaller in size, endowed with oversized ears and noses, and long bushy tails. Their modern appearance, codified in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], is that of a bulky humanoid creature equal or larger than an [[orc]] with thick [[grey skin|grey]] or [[dark skin|brown skin]], but with much less intelligence and very poor eyesight.

Not to be confused with the act of [[trolling]].

h4. See also

* [[dwarf]]
* [[elf]]
* [[ogre]]
* [[oni]]
* [[orc]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: fiora_(summer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Fiora (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]], specifically when dressed in her summer attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2019 "Summer Refreshes":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Summer_Refreshes_(Focus)] bannerâ€™s associated Tempest Trials event.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a blue [[halterneck]] [[bikini]] top with white [[frills]], which is parted to expose her [[navel]], [[yellow flower]]s in her hair, a cyan [[parasol]], white [[fingerless gloves]], and blue [[sandals]] with white frills.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Fiora in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: simulated_fingering
body:
When [[fingering]] is [[sexually suggestive|suggestively]] performed on an object, typically a [[yonic symbol]], but implied fingering could also be used to symbolically respresent [[anal fingering]]. 

In images of this kind there is usually [[suggestive fluid]] featured, meant to resemble [[pussy juice|vaginal fluids]]. If the image features an object resembling a [[pussy|vulva]] or [[pussy juice]], [[yonic symbol]] would also be an applicable tag. 

H4. See also
* [[tag group:simulated sex acts]]

title: simulated_thigh_sex
body:

title: rough_sex
body:
[[Sex|Sexual activity]] which is visibly very intense and energetic, and in which one or more of the participants may even appear to be in distress (though this does not necessarily mean that [[rape]] is occurring). May include elements such as [[bondage]] or [[tears]], and more violent actions such as [[asphyxiation]] or [[grabbing another's hair]]. Often will include [[spanking]] or have an [[ass]] that has been [[spanked]]. 

Contrast with [[happy sex]].

title: utada_hikaru
body:
[b]Utada Hikaru[/b] (January 19, 1983) is Japanese-American singer, songwriter and producer. Considered one of the most influential, bestselling musical artists in Japan, she has produced several hit songs including "Automatic", "First Love", "Can You Keep a Secret?" and "Simple and Clean", the theme song of the [[Kingdom Hearts]] games.

Having grew up in [[New York City]], Utada is fluent in English and Japanese. Has a son with her ex-husband, Francesco Calliano. On June 26, 2021, Utada came out as non-binary but uses both she/her and they/them pronouns.

title: friday_night_funkin'
body:
Free web rhythm game. You play as the Boyfriend, who must [[rapping|rap battle]] against his Girlfriend's evil dad in an attempt to win his approval. Later weeks feature other characters, both original as well as cameos from [[Newgrounds]]. 

Originally made for Ludum Dare 47, it was later released on Newgrounds and Itch around Halloween 2020. It has been updated with additional weeks since, and gained significant popularity on YouTube and TikTok.

title: low_tide_in_twilight
body:
Low Tide in Twilight is an ongoing manhwa written and illustrated by euja. Released in 2021, it has been published by Lezhin.

Kim Euihyun has decided he doesnâ€™t want to live. He feels nothing anymore. He has no future to look forward to. Now, heâ€™s looking into the abyss, holding in his arms the only thing that was keeping him alive. Itâ€™ll all be over soon. But someone grabs him from the waterâ€™s edge, and pulls him from the darkness. Euihyun, whose sole possession is a mountain of debt, has been rescued by Taeju. Now Taeju has offered Euihyun money, a house, and a job to help him out of his mess. But what will Taeju, who is intoxicated by Euihyunâ€™s smell, ask for in return? Could Taeju be the person that finally brings Euihyun out of his eternal twilightâ€¦?

If the ass is red or marked, include the [[spanked]] tag as well.

title: spanked
body:
A character that has been spanked (struck on the buttocks, with a bare hand or other object, for disciplinary or sexual reasons). This is usually indicated by  a red mark on their [[ass]], which may or may not be in the shape of a hand. General reddening of the [[ass]] also is indicative of spanking.

While not mutually exclusive with [[spanking]], in cases where there is no active spanking occurring, the spanked tag should be used stand alone. 

h4. See also

title: tenshi_kaiwai
body:
Japanese aesthetic and fashion style defined by the combination of light blue and white. More commonly referred to as simply "mizuiro" (water-colored).

Often features elements of kawaii subculture, and themes of angels, water, and/or technology. May overlap with [[yume kawaii]] or [[y2k fashion]] at times.

Fashion tends to include [[track jacket]]s and [[jersey maid]] outfits.

h4. See also

title: persian_speedwell
body:
[b][i]Veronica persica[/i][/b], commonly called Persian speedwell, is a [[flower]]ing plant in the plantain family ([i]Plantaginaceae[/i]). Other common names are: [b]bird's-eye[/b], [b]birdeye speedwell[/b], [b]common field-speedwell[/b], [b]large field speedwell[/b], and [b]winter speedwell[/b]. Native to Eurasia, it exists invasively in Britain, North America, and parts of East Asia.

Its small flowers feature four short, sky blue or purple petals interspersed with thin dark blue stripes. The petals lighten to white as you get closer to the center of the flower. The flowers have two conspicuously protruding stamens.

Not to be confused with [[Nemophila (flower)|]], which has somewhat similar flowers, but unlike Persian speedwell, Nemophila flowers have five petals and five less conspicuous stamens.

h5. Examples
* !asset #23123699: Photo reference, flower and its two stamens
* !asset #23123803: Photo reference, plant
* !post #6142091

h5. Other Plantaginaceae species

* [[Snapdragon]]

title: nemophila_(flower)
body:
[b][i]Nemophila[/i][/b], commonly called baby blue eyes, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Boraginaceae[/i]. Commonly represented by [i]Nemophila menziesii[/i].

Nemophila flowers are bell/cup shaped, with five stamens and five rounded petals, sometimes with notched tips. They usually come in a range of shades from light blue to purple or pink, becoming white near the stamens. Some species are white and occasionally spotted ([i]Nemophila maculata[/i]). The leaves are lobed or toothed.

Not to be confused with [[Persian speedwell]], which has somewhat similar flowers, but unlike Nemophila, Persian speedwell flowers have four petals and two conspicuously protruding stamens.

h5. Examples

title: foxglove
body:
[b][i]Digitalis[/i][/b] (from the Latin [i]digitus[/i], finger), commonly called foxglove, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Plantaginaceae[/i]. One of the most commonly depicted species of Digitalis is [i]Digitalis purpurea[/i], the common foxglove.

Foxglove produces a tall spike covered with long, tubular or funnel-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually spotted and can be pink, red, yellow, purple, and white. The leaves are oval and cover the stem below the flowers. Many species of foxglove are highly poisonous.

h5. Examples

title: amd
body:
[b]Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.[/b] ([b]AMD[/b]) is an American multinational semiconductor company based in Sunnyvale, California, United States, that develops [[computer]] processors and related technologies for business and consumer markets. AMD is the only significant rival to [[Intel]] in the central processor (CPU) market for (x86-based) personal computers. Since acquiring "ATI":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ATI_Technologies in 2006, AMD and its competitor [[Nvidia]] have dominated the discrete graphics processor unit (GPU) market.

Colloquially referred to as "Team Red".

body:
A [[bus]], typically yellow, designed to transport students to and from [[school]] or any school-related activities.  

In 1939 by conference a shade of yellow, now known as school bus yellow, was decided to be used as the standard color for school buses in North America. While there is no standard requiring yellow to be used on school buses outside of North America, the uniqueness of the color and its association with schools has lead to some school systems outside North America to also adopt school buses of this color.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: School bus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/School_bus]

title: silent_witch
body:
A 2021-to-Present shoujo fantasy light novel series written by Isora Matsuri and illustrated by [[fujimi nanna|Fujimi Nanna]].  Initially written as a webnovel series in 2020 before being published by Kadokawa as a light novel.  A manga adaptation also began publication in 2021 under the title [i]Silent Witch - Chinmoku no Majo no Kakushigoto[/i] (ã‚µã‚¤ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ»ã‚¦ã‚£ãƒƒãƒ æ²ˆé»™ã®é­”å¥³ã®éš ã—ã”ã¨, En: [i]Secrets of the Silent Witch[/i]) illustrated by Tana Tobi.

The story follows Monica Everett, a teenage mage and the youngest of the Kingdom of Ridill's Seven Sages and named the [i]Silent Witch[/i] .  As one of the Seven Sages, the highest rank of mage within the kingdom, she is famous for her ability of chantless casting of magic.  Unknown to the public though, Monica suffers from extreme social anxiety which is why she ended up developing the ability for chantless casting, as she simply lacked the ability to recite a spell in front of people.  Preferring to not interact with people, she spends most of her time doing mathematical work for the kingdom while living as a recluse. Things take a drastic turn when her fellow Seven Sage member Louis Miller, the [i]Barrier Mage[/i], barges into her home to ask her a favor, a favor she is not allowed to decline.  He is assigning her the task of infiltrating Serendia Academy, an elite boarding school, to covertly guard the kingdom's second prince without letting him find out.

h4. Characters

* [[Monica Everett]] (protagonist, alias Monica Norton)
* [[Cyril Ashley]]
* [[Felix Arc Ridill]] 
* [[Isabelle Norton]]
* [[Louis Miller]]
* [[Nero (Silent Witch)|]]
* [[Rynzbelfeid]]

title: mark_grayson
body:
[[Mark Grayson]], also known by his hero alias [[Invincible (character)|]], is the titular character of the [[Invincible (series)|]] comic and cartoon series. The son of the Viltrumite superhero [[Omni-man]] and his wife, the human woman [[Debbie Grayson]]. After Mark gains his powers at 17 years old, he discovers the harsh realities of being a superhero while struggling to define himself. He is shown to have a berserker side when fighting the Flaxans and Machine Head's villains, revealed to be a Viltrumite trait.

He is voiced by Steven Yeun in the Invincible animated series. Since Mark's voice actor is voiced by Korean-American actor Steven Yeun and his mother Debbie is voiced by Korean-Canadian actress Sandra Oh, Mark is portrayed as half-White, half-Korean in the series.

title: ashigara_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Ashigara[/i]. Introduced as part of the [i]Ink-Stained Steel Sakura[/i] rerun. Character design by [[Tetsujin Momoko]], voiced by [[Saitou Chiwa]].

Her base art portrays her with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[wolf ears]], and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a blue [[serafuku]] (with [[white sailor collar]]), [[blue skirt]], black [[thighhighs]], a single [[black gloves|black glove]] on her left hand, two white [[bracelet|bracelets]] on her right arm, and [[rudder footwear]]. She also wears [[headphones]] connected to a music player that looks like a [[Walkman]], and wields a [[katana]].

Her rig shows four 20.3 cm twin mounts, two per side, as well as two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] with the [[Sakura Empire (emblem)|Sakura Empire]] emblem marked on the splinter shield tops.

title: rattail
body:
A rattail is a hair style that is characterized by a long "tail"-like element of hair growing downward from the back of the head. The rattail usually hangs naturally; however, it can be braided, treated as a dread, permed, straightened, poofed, or curled with an iron. In some instances, an individual might choose to grow several tails as opposed to a single very long tail. A rattail is characterised by hair longer than the rest of the hair surrounding it.

title: unmoving_pattern
body:
A repeating clothing pattern (such as a [[checkered clothes|checkerboard]], [[plaid clothes|plaid]], or [[floral print]]) that does not follow the folds or contours of the clothes or body at all. 

If there is no repeating pattern, use [[double exposure]].

Featured in many, [i]many[/i] anime, as it's much cheaper and easier than adjusting the pattern realistically. Particularly noticeable in stylized or minimalistic shows such as [[Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei]] and [[Bakemonogatari]].

body:
A fictional manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

A general purpose [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed from the [[Geara Doga]]. Much larger in size than its predecessor, its distinctively [[Zeon]]-like appearance was intentionally evoked by the primary users of the type - the anti-[[earth_federation|Federation]] [[terrorist]] organization [i][[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]][/i].

title: sterkenburg_cranach
body:
A swordsman who appears in all four games of the Arland [[atelier (series)|Atelier]] series: [[Atelier Rorona]], [[Atelier Totori]], [[Atelier Meruru]] and [[Atelier Lulua]]. He goes by the nickname [b]Sterk[/b] since he knows his actual name is hard to pronounce. Sterk is a knight at heart and isn't pleased when the monarchy system is abolished to create the Arland Republic. Sterk is also known for scaring others with his appearance which often upsets him, and keeps white pigeons as pets/messengers.

In Atelier Rorona, he works as a castle guard and is the receptionist for Rorona's assignments. In Atelier Totori, the knighthood is dissolved and he works as a wandering adventurer, whom [[gino knab|Gino]] fervently demands to take him in as his pupil. In Atelier Meruru, Sterk is more than eager to serve Princess [[merurulince rede arls|Meruru]] to the point that it interferes with her work.

h4. Appearance

title: bad_id
body:
A post that is no longer available from the source link. Usually this is because the work was deleted by the artist.

Compare with [[bad source]], where the link does not point to the original image, and [[bad link]], where the source is correct but it leads to a direct image instead of a proper post.

h4. Guidelines

If another source for the image is found, follow these instructions:

* If the filesize and MD5 hash are the same, then change the source field to the new source, and remove the [[bad id]] tag(s). The MD5 hash can be compared with http://onlinemd5.com/ or https://md5file.com/calculator. Note: A source is legitimate only if it's hosted by the original artist.
* If the filesizes are different and the image is inferior, then just ignore it and do not upload it.
* If the filesizes are different and the image is superior, then upload it if you consider the image worthy, then parent the original to the upload (by clicking edit on the child post and pasting in the parent ID in the parent field) and then tag the original upload with the [[duplicate]] tag.

title: note_block_(mario)
body: An object in the [[Mario (series)|]] series, appearing as a block with a [[quarter note]] on it. Jumping on it causes [[Mario]] to bounce up, and also increases his jump height when he jumps off it. [[Super Mario Maker]] introduces the Music Block, a variant with an [[eighth note]] on it instead of a quarter note. It plays a short musical note when hit or landed on. [[Super Mario Bros. Wonder]] introduces the Marimba Block, a variant with [[beamed eighth notes]] on it. Unlike Note Blocks, they do not cause [[Mario]] and the others to bounce up, instead only increasing jump height.

title: sushang_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

She is an amateur member of the Xianzhou Luofu's Cloud Knights who aspires to become a renowned figure of the said group. Voiced by [[Fukuen Misato]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit is a stylized Cloud Knight uniform comprising a [[white dress]] worn under an outer layer [[black dress]] with [[yellow sleeves|yellow]] [[detached sleeves]], [[jingle bell]]s on [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Costumes
* !post #7690451: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
A naive and enthusiastic newcomer to the Cloud Knights who wields a Greatsword.

She envisions the historic legends of the Cloud Knights, and is eager to become such a figure herself.

As such, Sushang firmly believes in the philosophies "be eager to help those in need", "do one good deed a day and reflect on oneself three times a day", leading her to busy days full of helping others.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Li Sushang]] - her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: snow_bros.
body:
[b][i]Snow Bros.[/i][/b] is a 1990 [[fantasy]] and platform action [[arcade]] [[video game]] originally developed by [[Toaplan]]. 

It was first published in Japan, then in North America by Romstar and later in Europe. 

Starring the eponymous snowmen twins Nick and Tom, players are tasked with travelling through 50 stages, throwing and building snowballs, jumping on and off platforms to navigate level obstacles while dodging and defeating monsters in order to rescue the princesses Puripuri and Puchipuchi from captivity. 

Although first launched in arcades, the game was later ported across multiple platforms, each one being created by different third-party developers and featuring several changes or additions compared with the original version. Conversions for various microcomputers were in development but none were officially released to the public.

Snow Bros. was met with mostly positive reception from critics and players alike, earning an award from Gamest magazine and gaining a cult following since its initial release. In 1994, a sequel titled [[Snow Bros. 2: With New Elves]] was released by Hanafram, serving as the last game by Toaplan prior to their closure. 

The rights to the title are owned by Tatsujin, a Japanese company formed by former Toaplan employee Yuge Masahiro. A revival version of the game for the [[Nintendo Switch]] was released on May 19th, 2022.

Her default outfit consists of a white top with a center [[clothing cutout]], a [[black bra]] underneath, a golden [[headpiece]], [[green dress|green]] [[pleated dress]], white [[detached sleeves]], black [[bridal gauntlets]], [[red scarf]], red [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, red [[anklet]] on her left leg, and is [[barefoot]].

"Swords have a temper. Sometimes, you have to touch them to calm them down â€” put the hilt of the sword in your hand, and it'll tell you what's wrong!"

A sword hunter from the Xianzhou Zhuming and "the Flaming Heart" General Huaiyan's darling granddaughter. Frank and straightforward.
She practiced swordsmanship and forging from Huaiyan since young, and thus is the second-youngest prodigy swordmaster of the Flamewheel Octet.

Fueled by an intense loathing for the cursed swords that emerged from the Zhuming, she vowed to "hunt down and wipe out all cursed swords."

title: miyako_yoshika
body:
The "Loyal Undead". Stage 3 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]]. A [[jiangshi]], or Chinese zombie, with the ability to eat anything. Humans bitten by her may turn into a jiangshi temporarily. Assigned to guard the cemetery adjacent to the [[Myouren Temple]] by [[Kaku Seiga]], she's a tough opponent who takes her duties seriously but is somewhat dumb. Referred to as a "meaningless bodyguard" by ZUN. She is partially based on Miyako No Yoshika, a real 9th century poet who was rumored to be friends with [[Ibaraki Douji (touhou)|]].

h4. Appearance 
* !asset #23118598
Both her hair and eye color are inconsistently drawn, [[blue eyes|with]] [[black eyes|either]] [[purple eyes|being]] [[blue hair|blue]], [[black hair|black]], or [[purple hair|purple]]. She wears a [[purple hat|purple]] [[cabbie hat]] with a [[star hat ornament|star]], an [[ofuda]] on her forehead, a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[red shirt|red]] [[tangzhuang]] with [[lace-trimmed sleeves|a lace trim on the sleeves]], a [[black skirt]] sometimes with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print skirt|print]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: virtual_youtuber_shiten'nou
body:
[tn]Referred to as the Virtual YouTuber Four Heavenly Kings online (ãƒãƒ¼ãƒãƒ£ãƒ«YouTuberå››å¤©ç‹), and as "Virtual Oyabun and the Four Heavenly Kings" on Pixiv (ãƒãƒ¼ãƒãƒ£ãƒ«è¦ªåˆ†ã¨å››å¤©ç‹); other names include the Big Four, the "Council of Five Elders" (äº”å¤§è€) and the ""Permanent Members":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permanent_members_of_the_United_Nations_Security_Council]" (å¸¸ä»»ç†äº‹å›½).[/tn]

Used to refer to [[Kizuna AI]], [[Kaguya Luna]], [[Mirai Akari]], and [[Mikoko (kemomimi oukoku kokuei housou)|]] ("Nojaloli"/Nekomasu) and [[Dennou Shoujo Siro]], in reference to the Shiten'nou (Four Heavenly Kings).

The first [[Virtual YouTuber|VTubers]] to get big, a group originally thought to consist of Kizuna AI, Kaguya Luna, Mirai Akari, and Mikoko. Due to the enormous subscriber gap between her and the rest of her peers, Kizuna ascended past the category (now nicknamed Oyabun, popularized by Luna), allowing Siro to join its ranks. These five would be considered the core, seen as the driving force behind the VTuber boom around the end of 2017 and start of 2018. The title was thus bestowed upon them not necessarily due to them being the Top 5 in subscriber numbers, but as a honorary title by fans recognizing their contributions.

[expand= More details]

It could however be said that, with Nekomasu's rejection of the label of VTuber, culminating in his channel rebranding (and being sold) in July 2018, there are once more only four. Two broader versions of the Shiten'nou exist, which, aside from the original five, include either: a) [[Fujisaki Yua]], [[Fuji Aoi]] and [[Tokino Sora]], the 8 of them referred to as the VTuber Daisenpai (VTuberå¤§å…ˆè¼©), and the three by themselves as 3JK; b) Tokino Sora and [[Nora Cat]], the 7 of them referred to as the Seven Archangels (ï¼—å¤§å¤©ä½¿). Aside from Yua, Aoi, Sora and Nora, others who were speculated to be "potential":[https://altema.jp/sinnsitennnou] "candidates":[https://www.reddit.com/r/VirtualYoutubers/comments/g9iqe0/looking_back_possibly_new_vtuber_four_heavenly/] back in 2018 were [[Nekomiya Hinata]] (at the time one of the biggest frontrunners due to reaching the level of the Big Four), [[Hibiki Ao]], [[Roboco-san]], [[Koo Furan Zoopaa]], [[Tsukino Mito]], and [[Yomemi]]. Alongside these were also those considered to be predecessors to VTubers, "or":[https://twitter.com/Shiratori_Amaha/status/987718413584756737] "Pioneers":[https://twitter.com/Shiratori_Amaha/status/991625444330946560], such as [[Chiyu]], [[ILtan (infiniteloop)|]], [[Sayo-chan]], [[Weatheroid]] Airi and [[Ami Yamato]], as well as [[Super Sonico]], [[Eilene]] under ENTUM, etc; whom were not considered actual VTubers unless they had permanently rebranded themselves such. 

While it is questionable to speak of new Heavenly Kings from 2018 on due to tradition, several sub-contenders do exist - as an example, [[Yuikai (vtuber)|]], [[Natsumi Moe]], [[Kimino Miya]], [[Melody (projektmelody)|ProjektMelody]], [[Ironmouse]] and [[Hana Macchia]] as early contenders for the Big Four in (indie) EN spaces due to their early prominence and (for the most part) continued relevance, alongside others such as [[Deat (vtuber)|]], [[Comdost (vtuber)|]], [[Mira Pink]], [[Sapphy Stars]], the overseas members of [[WINKS Production]], and [[Beretta Bombshell]]. Alternatively, [[Tenkai Tsukasa]] inhabiting an Oyabun-esque position for Japanese male VTubers.

Following the massive boom in Western interest in VTubing from early 2020 on, particularly benefiting Cover's [[Hololive]], new contenders in the eyes of the West included [[Inugami Korone]] (who's garnered worldwide viewership thanks to her memetic moments), [[Usada Pekora]] (with the highest viewer count per month of all VTubers), [[Kiryu Coco]] (acting as an English-language gateway to VTubers to western viewers), and [[Gawr Gura]] (who has since become the biggest VTuber by subscribers in the world), with [[Akai Haato|Akai Haato/Haachama]], [[Mori Calliope]] and [[Watson Amelia|Amelia Watson]] becoming contenders for Coco's position with her retirement in July 2021. Beyond Hololive, other noteworthy VTubers who contributed to the 2020s boom include [[Amano Pikamee]], [[Fuzuki Miki]], [[Mint Fantome]], [[Lyrica (vtuber)|]], [[girl_dm]], and [[Nyatasha Nyanners]] ([[VShojo]] more broadly). [[NIJISANJI EN]]'s success (especially in proving the viability of male VTubers in EN spaces through [[Luxiem]]/[[Noctyx]]) has generally prompted a further rise in interest.
[/expand]

body: RyÅan-ji is a Zen Buddhist temple in [[kyoto|Kyoto, Japan]], renowned for its minimalist [[rock garden]], which is considered a masterpiece of Japanese garden design. Established in the late 15th century, it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a prominent example of Zen aesthetics.

body:

It was later released outside of Japan in an altered format under the name [[Super Mario Bros. 2]], since the original Japanese Super Mario Bros. sequel, Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels, was deemed too similar to the original and too difficult for overseas players. body: Kyoto Station is a major transportation hub located in [[kyoto|Kyoto, Japan]]. title: atlas_(battle_of_titans)
body:
A [[mecha]] ([i]Titan[/i]) that appeared in the game [[Battle of Titans]]. It is a heavy-class Titan with a shoulder-mounted laser weapon known as the [i]Dragon[/i].

Different from other [[walker (robot)|]] styled mecha in the game, Atlas is the only mecha that has a pair of mechanical arms connecting the weapons to its torso.

It frequently appears with a pair of [[autocannon]] known as the [i]Cyclone[/i].

Before its release, the mecha was named after the Russian legend "Ilya Muromets":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilya_Muromets].

title: dedf1sh
body:
NPC in [i][[Splatoon 2]][/i] and [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i].

A [[sanitized_(splatoon)|sanitized]] [[Octoling]] DJ that creates most of the music heard in [i][[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]][/i]. Her perfectionism in creating sounds led her to accidentally stumbling into a testing facility, where she was sanitized and remained for the entirety of the mode.

Like other sanitized members of her kind, she has [[green skin]] and [[purple_hair|purple]] [[tentacle hair]]. She wears a loose-fitting [[black shirt]] with [[bare shoulders]] as well as a [[baseball cap]], and appears to be wearing some sort of technological [[sunglasses]].

The supplementary magazine [i]Haikara Walker[/i] reveals her real name (in Japanese) to be [b]Mizuta Ahato[/b].
She later reappears under the name of [b]Acht[/b] in [i][[Splatoon 3: Side Order]][/i], where they are refered to as [b]Mizuta[/b] in Japanese. The name comes from Giant Pacific octopus (æ°´è›¸ï¼Œmizutako). Notably, since their appearance in Side Order, Acht is referred to with they/them pronouns in English.

title: dune_(series)
body:
A 1965 science fiction novel written by Frank Herbert. It won the Hugo Award in 1966, and the inaugural Nebula Award for Best Novel. Dune is frequently cited as the world's best-selling [[science fiction]] novel of all time.

Set thousands of years into the far future, amidst a sprawling feudal interstellar empire where planetary fiefdoms are controlled by noble houses that owe an allegiance to the Imperial House Corrino, Dune tells the story of young [[Paul Atreides]] (the heir apparent to Duke [[Leto Atreides]] and the heir of House Atreides) as he and his family accept control of the [[desert]] [[planet]] [[Dune (planet)|Arrakis]], the only source of the "spice" melange, the most important and valuable substance in the universe. The story explores the complex and multi-layered interactions of politics, religion, ecology, technology, and human emotion, as the forces of the Empire confront each other for control of Arrakis and its "spice".

Herbert wrote five sequels to the novel Dune: [i]Dune Messiah, Children of Dune, God Emperor of Dune, Heretics of Dune,[/i] and [i]Chapterhouse: Dune[/i]. The first novel has been adapted into a 1984 film by David Lynch, a 2000 Sci-Fi Channel miniseries [i]Frank Herbert's Dune[/i] and its 2003 sequel [i]Frank Herbert's Children of Dune[/i], and a 2021/2024 two-part film by Denis Villeneuve, as well as computer games, a board game, and songs. The franchise has also been continued beyond Herbert's death in 1986, with a series of prequels, interquels, and sequels that were co-written by Kevin J. Anderson and the author's son, Brian Herbert, starting in 1999.

h4. Works

* [[Dune (1984 movie)]]
* [[Dune (2021 movie)]]
* [[Dune: Part Two]]

title: dune_(planet)
body:
Dune, formally known as [i]Arrakis[/i], is a [[desert]] [[planet]] featured in the [[Dune (series)|]] series.

In Dune, the planet is the home of the [[Fremen]] and the only source of "Spice" in the universe. Arrakis is the third planet orbiting the star Canopus, and it in turn is orbited by two moons, one of which has the image of the desert kangaroo mouse, "Muad'Dib", on it; the other moon possesses the image of a human hand.

On April 5, 2010, a real-world plain of Saturn's moon Titan was named "Arrakis Planitia" after Herbert's fictional planet.

h4. See also

* [[Sandworm]]
* [[Dune (series)|]]

body:

title: useless_machine
body:
A machine whose only function is to turn itself off.

The best-known useless machines are those inspired by Marvin Minsky's design, in which the device's sole function is to switch itself off by operating its own "off" switch. Such machines were popularised commercially in the 1960s, sold as an amusing engineering hack, or as a joke.

SOAP is a brand of [[shoes]] that was founded in 1997. They are designed for [[skateboard]] grinding on railings because of the plastic concavity on their soles.

The shoes are best known for their appearance in the [[Sonic (series)|]] series. In [[Sonic Adventure 2]], [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] wears a custom version of the Scorcher variant, as grinding was introduced as a gameplay mechanic. They would continue to appear in later games such as [[Sonic Forces]] and [[Sonic Frontiers]].

title: ed_edd_n_eddy
body:
An animated television series created by Danny Antonucci for [[Cartoon Network]].

The series revolves around three friends named Ed, Edd (called "Double D" to avoid confusion with Ed), and Eddy. They live in a suburban cul-de-sac in the fictional town of Peach Creek along with fellow neighborhood children Kevin, Nazz, Sarah, Jimmy, Rolf, Jonny, and the Eds' female adversaries, the Kanker Sisters, Lee, Marie, and May. Under the unofficial leadership of Eddy, the trio frequently invents schemes to make money from their peers to purchase their favorite confection, jawbreakers. Their plans usually fail, leaving them in various, often humiliating and painful, predicaments.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ed, Edd n Eddy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed,_Edd_n_Eddy

The album also houses some of their highest-grossing singles "MANTRA" and nominated for the [i]Kerrang![/i] Awards for the Best Album as well as Grammy Awards for the Best Rock Album

title: br_class_55
body:
The British Rail Class 55, also known as a Deltic, or English Electric Type 5, (Originally numbered as the D9000 series before the TOPS classification system.) is a class of [[diesel locomotive]] built in 1961 and 1962 by English Electric for British Railways. Twenty-two locomotives were built, designed for the high-speed express passenger services on the East Coast Main Line (ECML) between Edinburgh and London King's Cross. They gained the name "Deltic" from the prototype locomotive, DP1 Deltic (the running number DP1 was never carried), which in turn was named after its Napier Deltic power units.

The clitoris is the homolog to the penis which means it shares many functions with it, such as erections.

title: hair_stick
body:
A [[hair ornament]] used to hold hair up or simply to be decorative, or both. It is [[stick]] shaped, long and usually narrow. The hair is wrapped around the hair stick and then pinned in place.

Hair sticks are extremely old and can be traced back to ancient China, Egypt, Greece and India. They can be as simple as a literal stick or branch, or highly intricate with lots of detail. 

For hair sticks with Chinese elements or dangle objects, use hair stick and [[Chinese hairpin]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7231090: Two very simple hair sticks
* !post #7620312: Ordinary object used has hair sticks, in this case [[paintbrush]]es.
* !post #7956036: [[Branch]] used as a hair stick.
* !post #7326975: Ornate Chinese hair stick.

h4.See also

* [[Hairpin]]
* [[Kanzashi]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hair stick":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_stick]

title: alt_text
body: A post that has additional commentary in the "alt" text of the image. The alt text is an additional written description of the image, supported by some sites. It's usually seen by clicking an "ALT" button in the lower left corner of the image. It's intended to provide a written description of the image for blind users, but normally it's also used by artists as extra commentary (in a similar vein to the [code]title[/code] attribute of the [code][/code] element). It's called "alt text" because in HTML, the text is stored in the [code]alt[/code] attribute of the [code][/code] element, like this: [code] [/code] Alt text is currently supported by Twitter, Tumblr, and Bluesky. The alt text should be placed in the artist's commentary if it isn't automatically retrieved from the source. Be sure to add the [[commentary request]] tag if the text needs to be translated. If the source has multiple images with alt text attached to them, do not feature every image's alt text in the commentary of one image, unless necessary (ex. image #2's alt text builds off of image #1's alt text). Only include the alt text of the given image. h4. Examples * https://twitter.com/satsukinosora/status/1777652767097606186 * https://grumpygryphon.tumblr.com/post/735684444950790144 h4. Formatting for Danbooru commentaries [code] [quote] h6. Image Description Text here [/quote] [/code] h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Alt attribute":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alt_attribute

title: dc_comics
body:
[b]DC Comics[/b] is one of the largest and oldest [[united_states|American]] [[comic]] book publishing houses, founded in 1934. Rival to [[Marvel]] Comics (even though both release crossover comics from time to time).

The majority of its publications take place within the DC Universe and feature numerous iconic superheroes and villains, including [[Superman]], [[Batman]], [[Wonder Woman]], [[The Flash]], [[Green Lantern]], and [[Aquaman (dc)|]].

title: yume_kawaii
body: Literally, "dream cute". Not necessarily cute as in [[tag group:subjective|subjective]] cuteness, but rather a specific aesthetic theme meant to give off the feeling of a floaty, dream-like environment that is conducive to emphasizing cuteness. Bright [[pastel colors|pastels]] and nostalgic appropriation of visual elements from [[retro artstyle|retro]] shoujo manga and anime are common motifs of the aesthetic. Yume Kawaii is also a fashion style, sometimes also referred to as "Fairy Kei". h4. Examples h5. Yume Kawaii fashion * !post #7843071 * !post #7817972 h5. Yume Kawaii aesthetic * !post #7873550 * !post #7851746 h4. See also * [[decora]] * [[heisei retro]] * [[yami kawaii]] * [[tag group:fashion style]]

body:

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[purple eyes]], and wears a [[hairband]]. When transformed into her [[magical girl|magical]] form, she wears a [[capelet]], a [[pleated skirt]], [[high heels|high heeled]] [[boots]] with [[argyle legwear|argyle]] patterns that cover the entire legs, and sometimes also has a [[shield]] on her lower left arm. title: mihama_chiyo
body:
[[Azumanga Daioh]] character.

The pint-size genius girl in the Azumanga class. Chiyo starts the series at 10, but she's already been bumped up to high school. She still has the innocence of a grade-schooler, and with her brains and can-do attitude, she makes friends easily; her only flaw is having a chip on her shoulder about her size. She's also richer than sin and owns a [[Tadakichi-san|dog]] so big she can ride it.

Chiyo is universally called [b]Chiyo-chan[/b] (with rare exceptions when [[Tanizaki Yukari|Yukari]] gets mad enough to use the insulting "Chiyo-suke"). She wears her hair in [[twintails|pigtails]] that have a unique shape and, if you ask [[Kasuga Ayumu|Osaka]], a life of their own. Her [[Mihama chiyo's father|father]] is a whole separate subject.

title: flak_jacket
body:
A type of [[body armor]] designed to protect from from explosive weaponry such as anti-aircraft artillery ("flak" is a German contraction for [i]Fliegerabwehrkanone[/i], "aircraft-defense gun") or grenade fragments. Its prominent usage was by the US military during the [[Vietnam War]], but cannot provide protection against higher velocity (rifle) bullets.

Compared to more modern soft [[bulletproof vest]]s or plate carriers with rigid-looking front, flak jackets look more loose-fitting as if it they have soft quilt, having buttoned or zipper front top, collared appearance, and many of them feature [[pocket]]s or [[pouch]]es.

title: mamianqun
body:
Mamianqun, (lit. 'Horse face skirt') is a traditonal Chinese skirt, considered a part of [[hanfu]]. The skirt originated from the [[Song dynasty|Song]] and [[Liao dynasty|Liao]] dynasties. 

The skirt is [[pleated skirt|pleated]] and is composed of two overlapping panels, attached to a band, which is then wrapped around the waist, making it a [[wrap skirt]]. It is typically long and can be easily recognized by its larger front and back pleats and smaller pleats along it's sides. 

Mamianqun is most often worn in [[aoqun]], but can be worn in [[ruqun]]. In modern times its also been worn with contemporary clothing items, creating a contrast between new and old. 

H4. Examples
* !post #7698009: A traditonal long mamianqun in purple. 
* !post #7660984: Knee-length mamianqun.

title: bullying
body:
The use of force or coercion to abuse or intimidate others. The behavior can be habitual and involve an imbalance of social or physical power. It can include verbal harassment or threat, physical or sexual assault or coercion and may be directed repeatedly towards particular victims, perhaps on grounds of race, religion, gender, sexuality, or ability. The victim of bullying is sometimes referred to as a "target".

Some methods of bullying include forcefully [[cutting hair]], [[graffiti]], [[humiliation]], [[memorial on desk]], [[grabbing another's hair]], simply [[punching]]/[[kicking]]/[[slapping]] the target, etc.

title: chinese_hairpin
body:
Ji (ç­“) (also known as fazan (é«®ç°ª or å‘ç°ª), zanzi (ç°ªå­) or zan (ç°ª) for short) and chai (é’—) are generic term for hairpin in China. 'Ji' (with the same character of ç¬„) is also the term used for hairpins of the Qin dynasty. The earliest form of Chinese hair stick was found in the Neolithic Hemudu culture relics; the hair stick was called ji (ç¬„), and were made from bones, horns, stones, and jade.

title: hydarnes
body:
Persian general who served under [[Xerxes]].

Son of an earlier Hydarnes who helped Darius the Great overthrow the usurper Gaumata/Bardiya, he led the elite Persian Immortals at the Battle of Thermopylae. They initially struggled against Leonidas's line defending the pass but after being informed of a secret path by a Greek traitor the Persian forces flanked the Spartans through that path, thus winning the battle for the Persians.

title: wraith_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]]' base roster. A former IMC scientist who lost her memories after becoming a test subject in her own experiments.

In her default appearance, Wraith wears a [[black bodysuit]] with a [[black scarf]], two [[brown belt]]s, [[thigh strap]]s, [[grey gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She has [[black hair]] worn in a [[single hair bun|single]] [[hair bun|bun]] with [[parted bangs]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[nose piercing]]. Her eyes have [[no pupils]] on her in-game model, though she has pupils in promotional videos and lore cinematics.

Her heirloom weapons are  [[hope's dusk (apex legends)|Hope's Dusk]] and [[Hope's Dawn (apex legends)|]]. Often pictured alongside the [[portal (object)|]]s she makes for her ultimate ability.

Voiced by "Shantel VanShanten":[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1416900/] in English and "Kojima Sachiko":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%B3%B6%E5%B9%B8%E5%AD%90] in Japanese

title: boombox
body:
A portable [[stereo]] system with a carrying handle that plays music from [[CD]]s, [[cassette tape]]s, or the [[radio]] using builtin [[speaker]]s.

Designed for portability, boomboxes can be powered by batteries or by a wall outlet. The boombox was introduced to the American market during the mid 1970s. The desire for louder and heavier bass led to bigger and heavier boxes. Thus, by the 1980s, some boomboxes had reached the size of a suitcase.

title: farm_merge_valley
body:
A casual farming social network game developed by CoolGames and published by Zynga (creator of Farmville). Originally releasing in November 2022 on Facebook, it has become available on multiple websites and services in the years since, most famously during Summer 2024 on Discord, via Discord Activities. The game received a surge of attention after getting added to Discord.

You merge animals, plants and resources together (at a minimum of 3 each, ideally 5) into higher tiers and exchange their products for coins, which you can use to buy more land.

body:
A play-by-web platform for TRPGs operated by a unique general-purpose system named "Lulmuhu", which allows players and game masters to host and participate in multiple game sessions, as well as managing their world-building. It also offers services such as "Alpaca Tailor", a commission service for medias (illustrations, voices, novels...) to use in TRPGs, and a point system to pay for PBW services.

title: gagharv_trilogy_mobile
body:
Tag for [I]The Legend of Heroes: Gagharv Trilogy[/I], a mobile remake of [[Falcom|Nihon Falcom's]] third to fifth entries in the [I][[Eiyuu Densetsu|Legend of Heroes]][/I] series: [I][[Shiroki Majo|III: Prophecy of the Moonlight Witch]][/I], [I][[Akai Shizuku|IV: A Tear of Vermillion]][/I], and [I][[Umi no Oriuta|V: A Cagesong of the Ocean]][/I]. Developed by Korean game developer FOW Games, it aims to compile all three narratives into one chronologically followed story, while expanding on the trilogy's extensive lore through unseen stories to be approved by Falcom. This will also be the second time the trilogy is released in English outside of Asian territories, preceded by the English localization of the PSP remakes by Microvision and Bandai Namco, released between 2005 to 2006.

First soft-launched in Australia, Canada, and Singapore in English on August 19, 2024, then fully launched for most countries on August 28 for Android, iOS, and PC, with Japanese and Traditional Chinese releases planned sometime in the future.

Use this tag for artworks that use the "modernized" redesigns of the Gagharv characters or anything that relates to the mobile game in general.

h4. External links

* "Official website.":[https://legendofheroes-fow.com/]
* "Japanese X/Twitter account.":[https://twitter.com/LoHGagharv_JP/]
* "Korean Naver CafÃ©.":[https://cafe.naver.com/legendofheroesm/] (requires a Naver account for full access)

title: felinid
body:
[b]Felinids[/b] are a fictional race of Cat people from [[Warhammer 40k]]. Originally from the planet Carlos McConnell, the Felinids are descendants of human colonists who spliced human DNA with feline DNA in order to survive the plane's harsh environment. Despite their Cat-like features, Felinids are not consider mutants but Abhumans by the Imperium of Man, similar to Ogryns and Ratlings.

As there is currently no official artwork of Felinids produced by Games Workshop, fans tend to portray the race as either furry cat people or regular humans with [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail]]s.

title: infection_monitor_(arknights)
body:
A device in the setting of the game [[Arknights]].

Infection monitors are worn by many personnel at Rhodes Island, typically those already suffering from oripathy, but also some uninfected individuals who are at risk of exposure.

In general, they resemble black, solid [[wristband]]s or circlets with inlaid blue lights. They are usually but not always worn close to external [[oripathy lesion (arknights)|]]s when those are present.

Common varieties include the collars worn by [[Angelina (Arknights)|]] and [[Matterhorn (Arknights)|]], the anklets worn by [[Ifrit (Arknights)|]] and [[Silence (Arknights)|]], and the rings worn by [[Amiya (Arknights)|]].

h5.Examples
* !post #8000128: Collar
* !post #5541506: Rings

title: iguana

title: bara
body:
Bara ("Gei komi'":[https://www.fujoshi.info/geikomi] in Japan) is a Japanese genre of manga and art (usually) by and for gay and bisexual men. With heavy focus on the masculine features and appeal of [[mature male|men]]. 

While mostly dependent on an artist's personal tastes, the â€˜baraâ€™ archetype features 3 main body types:
* Bear-type bodies, (typically tagged as [[plump]] or [[fat]]), are generally softer and rounder looking, with varying degrees of visible musculature.
- Artists: [[Suv (suv032)|]], [[Kuro nezumi inu]], [[Tevit (tevit15)|]].

* Hunks/Jocks or [[muscular|Muscular-type]] bodies, in contrast to the chiseled [[v-taper | triangular look]] of professional bodybuilders, have defined musculature that is usually more proportional overall, similar to that of athletic "strongman":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongman], with a [[strongman waist | wider waist]] ("comparison":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/e8/4f/e84f5efad6fd9ef1ff268d1982a564d6.jpg]), though the more [[shredded muscle | chiseled]] appearance can be a stylistic choice (see [[Nikism]] for reference).
- Artists: [[Tarutoru]], [[Crow (siranui)|]], [[Dopey (dopq)|]].

* Twunk or otter-type bodies, tagged [[toned]], [i]or[/i] [[muscular]] (especially with younger or sometimes older [[mature male]]s). 
- Artists: [[itto_(mentaiko)|Mentaiko]], [[Homri]], [[Torakichi (ebitendon)|]], [[Kuroshinki]]. 

Musculature, when depicted, is typically more exaggerated for emphasis (e.g. [[pectorals|pecs]]) along with the [[bulge]] (implying an exaggerated penis size), and both are usually rather noticeable even when the subject is wearing clothes -  abnormally so. When this exaggeration is paired with the points above, which assert a softer approach when drawing the male form, the 'bara' archetype becomes noticeable.

Common masculine features on subjects include: different degrees of [[facial hair|facial]] and [[body hair]] (especially the [[navel hair|happy trail]] leading to [[male pubic hair|pubic hair]]) - or a complete absence of it in the case of younger characters (depending on the artist's tastes), [[thick eyebrows|thick]], [[eyebrow cut|cut]] or [[forked eyebrows|bushy eyebrows]], [[sideburns]], [[buzz cut]], [[large hands]], [[scar]]s, [[tattoo]]s, [[bandaid]]s, [[bandage]]s, [[wrinkled skin|wrinkles]] (visible with [[mature male|mature]] and [[old man|old]] men), etc.

All of these characteristics lend the style a degree of flexibility that allows for further stylization as well as broader cultural mixing between communities; for instance, despite baraâ€™s roots in opposition to them, there is substantial cross-over with the larger [[yaoi|Boys' Love]] community - which can be seen in some artists' styles (E.g [[Yotti]], [[Arima (arima_bn)|]]). It can also be applied to non-human and humanoid characters, such as [[furry male]]s  (E.g [[Wafu (youzora_samo18)|]], [[Boogbogex]]).

[expand= History and meaning]

The word "bara" literally means "rose" in Japanese. The term originally comes from the magazine "Barazoku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barazoku], Japan's first gay men's magazine, with the term traditionally referring to more [[bishounen]]-esque men. As a result, the word "bara" also began being used as a slang term for any male homoerotic works in general (similar to the use of [[yaoi]] in the West).

The word "bara" as used here is primarily Western, stemming more from its application on art more commonly known as "gei komi", "gei manga", or "mens love" in Japan, a practice that began on Japanese imageboards, where they intentionally misappropriated the term, this interpretation later being exported abroad. Whilst some Japanese gei komi creators oppose the usage of "bara" due to its earlier legacy, others have embraced it. Note that, like most Manga Demographics, bara is commonly defined in terms of the target audience, not the authors or the subject matter.

Bara conceptually often contrasts with yaoi, which is gay male media traditionally made by heterosexual women to appeal to other heterosexual women. Whereas bara is gay/bi male media made by gay/bi men for gay/bi men, that generally features romantic and sexual relationships between [[muscular]] [[mature male|mature men]] and realistic(ish) relationships, often including LGBTQ issues, [[yaoi]] generally features androgynous, idealized, effeminate characters and melodramatic plots devoid of LGBTQ issues (like most [[yuri]], for similar root reasons). By its nature, it is also heteronormative, whether by stereotypically depicting overly emotional relationships or using concepts such as "uke" and "seme," and includes themes of homosociality, which contributed more to the clash between fans of the two genres, though nowadays there's a grey area between the two. What they share in common the most though is the fact that non-Japanese audiences have misappropriated them, with yaoi having become a generalized weeb term for anything involving gay men.
 [/expand]

title: phimosis
body:
A condition where the penile [[foreskin]] cannot be fully retracted from the head of the [[penis]]. The term may also refer to [[clitoris|clitoral]] phimosis, whereby the [[clitoral hood]] cannot be retracted, limiting exposure of the glans clitoridis.

In pre-adolescence, the foreskin is adhered to the glans penis, gradually separating before adulthood, leading to a similar depiction for pre- and pubescent characters.

For tagging purposes, this is applicable when the prepuce is not depicted as fully retracted during an [[erection|erec]][[erect_clitoris|tion]].

title: letterman_jacket
body:
A sports [[jacket]] commonly worn by American high school/college students and athletes. Traditionally, the wearing of such a jacket indicates that the student has met a specified level of participation or performance on a varsity team.

Letterman jackets commonly have a large letter (hence "letter"man) on one side on the jackets chest, indicating typically the name of a school or team. The sleeves are often a different color from the jackets body. The jackets collar is often also horizontally striped.

h4. Examples

* !post #8016717: Letterman jacket with collar stripe, different arm and body colors and letter on the chest 
* !post #8042320: Letterman jacket without chest letter.
* !post #7639379

h4. See also

* [[sukajan]]
* [[track jacket]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Letterman (sports)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letterman_(sports)#Letter_jacket]

title: art_nouveau
body:
An art movement popular during the late 19th and early 20th century that combined fine art, graphic and industrial design. Although Art Nouveau was not a single style, Le Style Mucha (The style of (Alphonse) Mucha), as characterized by bold lines, flat, rich colors, flowing curves and ornate circular patterns is often considered the quintessential style of the movement.

The German version of Art Nouveau goes by "Jugend", german for "youth". In Sweden this is also the predominant term. Art Nouveau differs in style from country to country.

h4. See also

* [[Art Deco]]
* [[East Asian architecture]]
* [[Greco-Roman architecture]]
* [[Gothic architecture]]

title: japan_national_police
body:
Japan's national police force. Unlike the national police from various other countries, they do not have jurisdictions of their own. They are instead responsible for supervising every prefectural police department in the country.

h4. Identifications
There are several examples to make them qualify for the tag:
* Their [[police car]]s are painted white on the top and black on the bottom. Their emergency lights are red.
* Their [[bus]]es, [[truck]]s and [[police helicopter|helicopter]]s are painted blue.
* Their [[police uniform]]s are either a [[blue shirt]] and [[blue pants]] or [[white shirt]] and [[blue pants]].
* Some officers wear [[blue vest]]s, some others wear [[blue jacket]]s. Some officers may wear a [[blue necktie]] as well.
* Some officers wear a [[green armband]] on their left arm.
* Female police officers wear a round [[police hat]].

h4. Uniforms
* !post #8118201: [[Blue shirt]] with no vest
* !post #8131563: [[Blue shirt]] with a [[vest]]

title: pope_in_white_puffer_jacket_(meme)
body:
Pope in White Puffer Jacket, also known as Balenciaga Pope and [[Pope Francis]] Drip, is an [[AI-generated]] image of Pope Francis wearing a long white puffer coat, which was created with [[Midjourney]]. The photo inspired many jokes and memes about the Pope, drip and hip-hop culture. It also looked realistic enough to many that a notable portion believed it was a genuine photo, leading to debate over the consequences and possibilities of artificial intelligence.
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/pope-in-white-puffer-jacket-pope-francis-drip

title: vietnamese_flag
body: The flag of [[Vietnam]], or "red flag with a gold star" (cá» Ä‘á» sao vÃ ng), was designed in 1940 and used during an uprising against French rule in southern Vietnam that year. Red symbolizes the goals of social revolution behind the Vietnamese, national uprising. The star represents the five main classes in Vietnamese societyâ€”intellectuals, farmers, workers, businesspeople and military personnel.

title: scottish_flag
body: More properly known as St. Andrew's Saltire, St. Andrew being the patron saint of [[Scotland]], who was crucified on a [[saltire]] (X-shaped cross) rather than conventional cross. It consists of a white saltire centered on a blue field. The [[English Flag]], Scottish Flag and St. Patrick's Saltire are combined to form the [[Union Jack]], the flag of the United Kingdom.

title: english_flag
body: More properly known as St George's Cross, St George being the patron saint of England and one-time dragon slayer.  It consists of a red cross centered on a white field. The English Flag, [[Scottish Flag]] and St. Patrick's Saltire are combined to form the [[Union Jack]], the flag of the United Kingdom.

title: swedish_flag
body:
The banner of the [[sweden|Kingdom of Sweden]].

The design of the flag is a heraldic-right-shifted (towards the flagpole) golden-yellow cross on a light middle-blue background. The exact dimensions of the flag are 4-2-4:5-2-9 for a total proportion of 10:16, which is number that approaches the golden ratio. Key things to take note of is that the blue fields towards the flagpole are [i]not[/i] square and the thickness of the cross is half of the blue fields' height.

Legends say that Eric IX ("Eric the Holy") saw the golden cross in the sky when he landed in Finland during the first Swedish crusade in 1157. He took it as a sign from god and made it his flag. However, the legend doesn't match up to the historic usage of the flag nor is there evidence of such a crusade. More likely, the Swedish flag was created in resistance to Denmark -Sweden's arch-nemesis since ancient times- and took inspiration from their flag, [[danish_flag|Dannebrogen]]. The blue and yellow were already commonly used as Swedish colours, for example in [[tre kronor]] which is the national [[coat of arms]].

There is a military variant of the flag which is significantly longer and has the end cut into three tongues. The proportions on this flag is 1:2. The tongues are cut from each field with the outer edges of the blue fields remaining straight and uncut. The length of the tongues is such that the uncut part of the flag has equally much blue on each side of the cross. The proportions are thus best described as 4-2-4:5-2-5-[b]8[/b] where the last number is the tongues. This flag can have white 5-pointed stars in the upper right field to denote admiralty rank and are only used on navy vessels. Other versions exists with a white square on the centre of the cross. If the square extends outside the cross and has the coat of arms of Sweden, then it is the flag of the King and Queen. Other members of the royal family uses a variant with a smaller square that doesn't extend outside the cross and instead carry a different insignia on it.

In civilian usage the flag was almost exclusively used at sea. The biggest breakthrough towards flying the flag more was made on the 6th of June in 1916 when "Day of the Swedish Flag" was celebrated for the first time, a day which unofficially became Sweden's national holiday until it was officially recognized in 1983.

There are no strict laws governing the flying of the flag, except for the royal and military variants. Everyone is allowed to fly the flag whenever they want and for whatever reason that they find worth flying it for. However, there are several traditions and "unwritten rules" which are good customs to follow, the most important of which is to not fly the flag at night and to not fly the flag for no reason. The most common occasion that Swedes fly the flag for are birthdays and midsummer's eve. Swedish calendars also come with special "flag days" marked, which are good days to fly the flag on such as royal birthdays and historical anniversaries.

* !asset #20125162

h4. See also

* [[Danish flag]]
* [[Finnish flag]]
* [[Icelandic flag]]
* [[Norwegian flag]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Sweden

title: nauruan_flag
body:
The Nauruan flag is a blue field with the thin yellow narrow horizontal stripe across in the center and the large white twelve-pointed [[star_(symbol)|star]] on the bottom of the stripe and near the hoist-side.

The narrow gold stripe with a width of 1â„12 of the length of the flag represents the Equator. The stripe along with the star signifies the location of the island in the Pacific Ocean one degree south of the Equator. The separation of the blue flag cloth into two equal parts recalls the saga, that the first inhabitants were to have been brought to Earth from two boulders.

Nauru itself is symbolized by a white 12-pointed star. The twelve points on the star represent the island's twelve original tribes.

The flag of Nauru was adopted on independence day, 31 January 1968.

title: libyan_flag
body:

During [[Muammar Gaddafi|Muammar Gaddafi's]] government from 1977 until his death in 2011, it was plain green.

title: honduran_flag
body:
The flag of [[Honduras]] consists of three equal horizontal stripes of turquoise, white and turquoise, with five turquoise stars in a quincuncial pattern at the center of the middle stripe. 

The two outer bands represent the Pacific Ocean and the Caribbean Sea, and also represent the blue sky and brotherhood. The inner band represents the land between the ocean and the sea, the peace and prosperity of its people, and purity of thoughts. The five stars represent the five nations of the former Federal Republic of Central America and the hope that the nations may form a union again.

The flag of Honduras was officially adopted on March 7th, 1866, and was modified in 2022.

title: guatemalan_flag
body:
The flag of [[Guatemala]] is a vertical triband of Maya blue (hoist-side and fly-side) and white with the national emblem centered on the white band.

The two sky blue stripes represent the fact that Guatemala is a land located between two oceans, the [[Pacific Ocean]] and the [[Atlantic Ocean]] (Caribbean sea); and the sky over the country. The white signifies peace and purity. The blue and white colors, like those of several other countries in the region, are based on the flag of the former Federal Republic of Central America.

The flag of Guatemala was officially adopted in 1871.

title: finnish_flag
body:
The flag of [[Finland]]. A blue [[Nordic Cross]] on a white background.

Designed in the 19th century and officially adopted in 1918.

Variant flags typically feature the lion-themed coat of arms added on the center of the cross. The temporary state flag of 1917â€”1918 was entirely based on the coat of arms.

title: atlantis_(kinnikuman)
body:
One of the Seven Devil Chojin in [[Kinnikuman]]. A green-scaled archer fishman with blood-red eyes. He specializes in water manipulation and aquatic wrestling. Defeated [[Robin Mask]], lost to [[Kinnikuman_(character)|Kinnikuman]] and fought Marlinman to a standstill. 

There's a meme based on the scene where Atlantis beats Robin Mask. Robin Mask's knightly mask rises from the surface of the water, only to reveal Atlantis's vicious claw poking through it. Atlantis laughs at the audience with sadistic glee.

Despite his victory over Robin Mask, Atlantis respects Robin Mask and gets insulted if anyone dares to insult the man, as Marlinman found out the hard way.

title: ishowspeed_trying_not_to_laugh_(meme)
body:
This meme references a clipped moment from one of IShowSpeed's [[Fortnite]] streams on 31 December 2021, where he plays 1v1 wager battles against his fans. 

One of Speed's opponents, a seemingly financially-challenged teenager, starts to hysterically breakdown from his continuous defeats, crying about his struggling economic situation and how his mother is 'kinda homeless', which humors Speed from his delivery. However, he is called out by another fan for almost laughing, which forces Speed to suppress it, making a smiling, tight-lipped expression.

h5. Source
* "EARLY STREAM!":https://youtu.be/ZIPCptw_Otg?t=7677 @ 2:07:57

title: hayami_kanade
body:
An [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. 

She is a 17 year old idol who is incredibly flirtatious, often flat-out asking the Producer to kiss her. Despite that, it's very hard to tell what she's thinking, or if she's joking or not; though she seems to be a very open person at first glance, she actually remains distant and mysterious. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the seventh CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Himekawa Yuki]], [[Ichihara Nina]], [[Miyamoto Frederica]], and [[Sagisawa Fumika]]. She is voiced by [[Iida Yuuko]].

body:

Her most prominent feature is her straight dark brown hair, which is always done up with a bow. She hates her name, and prefers to be referred to by her surname, but after becoming closer with the producer, she becomes more accepting of him calling her by her first name.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shiomi Syuko]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Sakurai Momoka]]. She is voiced by [[Satou Amina]].

title: buckshot_roulette
body:
Buckshot Roulette is an indie game developed by Mike Klubnika, which gained traction around the late 2023 to early 2024.

The game is similar to the real life "[[Russian Roulette]]" game where players take turns firing blanks using a revolver. However, in-game, a [[pump action]] [[shotgun]] is used instead.

A [[Dealer_(buckshot_roulette)|]] loads in blank and live rounds into the shotgun, wherein the player goes first and can make a choice to shoot themselves or the dealer. If a blank is fired on oneself, they get another turn firing the shotgun. If a blank is fired on the opponent, their turn ends. If a live round is fired on oneself or the opponent, they take damage.

title: analogue:_a_hate_story
body:
[b]Analogue: A Hate Story[/b] is a [[visual novel]] created by independent designer and visual novelist "Christine Love":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christine_Love_%28visual_novelist%29. It was created with the "Ren'Py":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ren%27Py engine, and was first released for download on the author's website in February 2012. A sequel set centuries after Love's earlier work, [[Digital: A Love Story]] (2010), [b]Analogue[/b] revolves around an unnamed investigator, who is tasked with discovering the reason for an interstellar ship's disappearance once it reappears after 600 years. The game's themes focus similarly around human/computer interaction, interpersonal relationships, and LGBT issues; but focus primarily on "transhumanism, traditional marriage, loneliness and [[cosplay]]".

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://ahatestory.com/
* "Visual Novel Database: Analogue: A Hate Story":https://vndb.org/v9680

body:

[Spoilers]The player is initially encouraged to believe she is a spy for [[Hargon]]'s followers by her friend, [[rick_(dqb2)|Rick]]. However, it is revealed later that Rick was actually the spy. title: e-girl
body:
Western alternative fashion trend that emerged in the late 2010s and began to pick up in popularity in the 2020s. Its origins are derived from [[emo fashion]], [[scene fashion]] and [[streetwear]]. It is associated with social media and Internet culture, and sexuality.

The fashion often consists of baggy clothing, mesh, [[chain]]s and [[padlock]]s, [[crop top]]s, [[choker]]s, [[beanie]]s and [[bucket hat]]s, and [[platform footwear]]. Hair is often dyed in two colors, either [[split-color hair]] or [[colored inner hair]], with one of the colors usually being black or a dark brown. Heavy makeup, particularly [[eyeliner]], is also common, and black heart stickers are commonly worn on the cheek.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: E-kid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-kid
* "Aesthetics Wiki: E-Girl":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/E-Girl

h4. See also

* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: h&k_mp5
body:
The MP5 ([i]Maschinenpistole 5[/i]) is a [[submachine gun]] of German origin, developed in the 1960s and manufactured by [[Heckler & Koch]]. Its design is based on scaled-down [[h&k g3|G3]] rifle. The models are available in fixed buttstock version and the retractable one.

This tag should be used for the original [b]full-sized MP5[/b] models without integrated suppressors.

title: uzi
body:
An open-bolt [[submachine gun]] of Israeli origin, introduced in 1954 and designed by Major "Uziel Gal":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uziel_Gal of the [[israel defense forces|IDF]]. The Uzi is more compact, cheaper to produce and lighter compared to previous SMG designs, thanks to its telescoping bolt design and stamped sheet metal components. The [[weapon]] is recognizable by its squared-off shape, an angular trigger guard, prominent iron sights, and a grip-loaded magazine.

This tag is reserved for the [b]full-sized Uzi[/b], which is commonly depicted with a metal triangular collapsible stock.

h4. See also
* [[Micro Uzi]]
* [[Mini Uzi]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: high-visibility_clothing
body:
Clothing designed to be highly visible for security purposes, often with use of reflective strips. Such as the high visibility jackets of railway workers or hunters.

From Wikipedia 

[quote] High-visibility clothing, sometimes shortened to hi vis or hi viz, is any clothing worn that is highly luminescent in its natural matt property or a color that is easily discernible from any background. It is most commonly worn on the torso and arm area of the body. Health and safety regulations often require the use of high visibility clothing as it is a form of personal protective equipment.[1][2][3] Many colors of high visibility vests are available, with yellow and orange being the most common examples. Colors other than yellow or orange may not provide adequate luminescence for conformity to standards such as ISO 20471.

As a form of personal protective equipment, high-visibility clothing is worn to increase a person's visibility and therefore prevent accidents caused by persons not being seen. As a result, it is often worn in occupations where hazardous situations are created by moving vehicles or low lighting conditions. These occupations include railway and road workers, airport workers and emergency services. Cyclists and motorcyclists may also use high-visibility clothing to increase their visibility when operating amongst motor traffic.[4] Hunters may be required to wear designated high-visibility clothing to prevent accidental shooting.  [/quote]

h4. Individual examples
* [[high-visibility vest]]
* [[high-visibility jacket]]
* [[high-visibility pants]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: High-visibility clothing":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-visibility_clothing]

title: limited_life_smp
body:
Fourth season of [[Traffic Life Series]]. It ran from March 3 to April 21, 2023.

This series drastically alters the standard gameplay mechanics. Players are now given a timer set for 24 "hours". For each death, they lose one hour, and for each kill of another player, they gain 30 minutes. Yellow players are now able to kill green players to recieve time.

title: mmmm_cow_(meme)
body:
Otis' Sneaky Dance, also know as Mmmm Cow, refers to a series of video edits from a scene in the 2006 animated film Barnyard in which the cow character Otis teases a mailman behind his back. In the videos, Otis is replaced with other cows or pop culture references for comedic effect. While the first video within the format went viral in October 2020, it did not achieve popularity until February 2021. The meme is based on the same scene as Perhaps.

h2. External links
"Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/otis-sneaky-dance]

title: sverigedrakten
body:
SverigedrÃ¤kten is the dress worn for celebrations by the kvinnliga nationaldrÃ¤ktsfÃ¶reningen (Women's national dress association). The costume was created in the early 1900s to be a dress wearable for any women in Sweden-Norway union, regardless of specific geographical origin. Older traditional [[Swedish clothes]] differ from region within Sweden and indicate where in the nation you come from.

Today SverigedrÃ¤kten is treated as an official inofficial national dress of Sweden. Swedish royals are often seen wearing it.

The dress is in yellow and blue, resembling the colors of the [[Swedish flag]]. It typically includes a white [[blouse]] worn under the dress. The dress itself is typically blue with a yellow [[waist apron]] and some sort of [[chamomile]] [[flower]] decoration.
H4. Examples
* !post #8113486: Traditional/faithful depiction of SverigedrÃ¤kten
* !post #8050469: A non-traditional SverigedrÃ¤kt
There exists also a less commonly worn men's version of the dress. 
* !post #5546741: Male version of SverigedrÃ¤kten

title: m43_field_cap
body:
A type of [[military hat]] modeled after a ski cap which was used by the German [[Wehrmacht]] and [[waffen-ss|SS]], during [[World War II]]. The bill was slightly extended and the top panel of the hat had a smaller circumference, giving it slightly sloped in sides.

Recognizable by its high peak, a teardrop shaped top, a short bill, and a small skirt that folds down to protect the ears. The M43 field cap was generally [[grey hat|field grey]] or [[blue hat|blue]], depending on whether it was used by the Heer, SS, or the [[Luftwaffe]].

h4. Examples
* !post #8010189: [[Wehrmacht]] variant.

title: land_of_light
body:
The homeworld of the [[giant of light|Giants of Light]], the [[Ultra Series|Ultras]], located in the M78 Nebula. It is depicted as a fragmented planet mostly composed of a clear green crystal material, which reflects the light and heat of the Plasma Spark, an artifical sun whose rays turned the people of the land into the Giants; an appearance codified from [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]] onward.

Notable locations include the Inter Galactic Defense Force Headquarters, where the Ultra members of the IGDF are given missions and dispatched, the Ultra Colosseum where Ultras train in combat, the Ultra Space Port which has a barrier protecting non-Ultra visitors from the Plasma Spark's rays, and Plasma Spark Tower, where the artificial sun is kept.

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Land of Light":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Land_of_Light]

title: cropped
body:
An image that is a cropped portion of a larger picture. 

It's not uncommon for artists on Twitter to post both the full-size picture and a crop, in order to play around twitter's cropping mechanism. Sometimes the cropped version is of higher resolution than the equivalent portion of the full picture, in which case it makes sense to upload both images. 
Generally, you should make the cropped post the child post, even if it is of higher resolution than the uncropped post.

It is also possible that the full size image is only available as a [[paid reward]].

h4.See also

* [[duplicate]]
* [[paid reward available]]
* [[third-party edit]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

body:
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban is the third instalment novel in the [[Harry Potter (series)|]] series written by J. K. Rowling. It was first published in 1999.
A film based on the book, released on 31 May 2004 in the UK, and 4 June 2004 in North America. Alfonso CuarÃ³n made his directorial debut for the series.
It chronicles [[harry potter|Harry's]] third year at Hogwarts and his quest to uncover the truth about his past, including the connection recently-escaped Azkaban prisoner [[Sirius Black]] has to Harry and his deceased parents.

body: A character in the [[Mario (series)|]] franchise. They are multi-segmented [[cactus|cacti]] capable of moving around. Its spikes make it a dangerous foe. It is possible to knock away one of its segments (or have [[Yoshi]] eat it) without defeating it; only taking out the head will defeat it outright. title: command_&_conquer
body:
[b]Command & Conquer[/b] (C&C) is a series primarily of real time strategy PC [[video game]]s that began with the eponymous first title in 1995.  First created by Westwood Studios, and later by [[Electronic Arts]] after they acquired Westwood and later dissolved Westwood Studios in 2003.  

Many former Westwood staff founded the studio Petroglyph Games, which was tapped by EA to develop a remaster of the original C&C games that was released in 2020.  Along with Westwood's previous RTS game Dune 2 (based on the sci-fi series [[Dune (series)|]]), the early C&C games helped codified the RTS genre.  The games were well know for their large tanks, live action cutscenes, mostly solid (albeit cheesy) story in the earlier installments, and great music.

The three C&C sub series:

* [i]Tiberium[/i] series (C&C Tiberian Dawn, [[Command and Conquer: Tiberian Sun]], [[Command and Conquer: Tiberium Wars]], C&C4 Tiberium Twilight): A toxic green alien space substance crashes on Earth.  Initially a boon by leeching out important minerals from the ground, making mining and energy easier to come by, it starts replicating out of control and mutating the landscape. Two initial factions, the UN agency the [[Global Defense Initiative]] and the mysterious cult the [[Brotherhood of Nod]], end up fighting over control of the world.

* [i]Red Alert[/i] series ([[Command and Conquer: Red Alert]], [[command & conquer: red alert 2|RA2]], [[command & conquer: red alert 3|RA3]]):  After World War II, [[Albert Einstein]] creates a time machine and goes back in time to erase [[Adolf Hitler]] from the timeline.  This ends up causing a timeline with a stronger Soviet Union that invades Europe.  The two initial factions were the Allies and the Soviet Union.  They're later joined by the third faction, The Empire of the Rising Sun.  The series generally has a much campier tone and comic book style plot.  Time travel plays a role throughout the various games.

* [i][[command & conquer: generals|Generals]][/i] series: the War of Terror in RTS format! The only series completely made by EALA and lacking live action cutscenes (except Generals Zero Hour).  The series featured three factions: United States, China, and the terrorist group, the Global Liberation Army.

title: deathfacer
body:
A robotic [[mecha]] from [[Ultraman Tiga & Ultraman Dyna: Hikari no Hoshi no Senshi-tachi|Ultraman Tiga & Ultraman Dyna: Warriors of the Star of Light]].

Originally known as [b]Prometheus[/b], this mecha was built by TPC, the organization from [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]] and [[Ultraman Dyna (series)|]].

It was then hijacked by the Monera aliens, and was transformed into a giant robot to defeat [[Ultraman Dyna]].

title: biellmann_spin
body:
The Biellmann spin is a difficult variation of the layback spin in figure skating made popular by world champion Denise Biellmann. It is executed by the skater grabbing their free blade and pulling the heel of their boot behind and above the level of the head so that their legs are in an approximate full split, with the head and back arched upward.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Biellmann spin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biellmann_spin]

title: kamov_ka-52
body: Kamov Ka-52 "Alligator" Developed from Ka-50, Ka-52 is a two-seat counter-rotating coaxial-rotor [[attack helicopter]] used primarily by the [[russian air force|Russian Aerospace Forces]] and Russian Naval Aviation, NATO report name for Ka-52 is 'Hokum B'. Ka-52 has three mounting hardpoints on each wing for [[missile pod|rocket pods]], [[missile]]s and external fuel tanks, also fitted with a 30mm calibre Shipunov 2A42 [[autocannon]] under the cockpit.

title: unzen_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Unzen[/i]. Character designed by [[Kincora]], voiced by [[Mimori Suzuko]]. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] that [[hair over one eye|covers her left eye]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[floral print]] [[white dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[wide sleeves]] colored purple and themed as wings, [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[high heels]], [[white coat]], and large [[butterfly wings]] to the back of her clothes. Her [[rigging]] consists of a large white circle to her back with a [[sakuramon]] and [[radar]] antenna plus six 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], and two hull pieces, one on each side, containing her four 203 mm triple mounts. Unzen is the first one to introduce such a ship that is outside of Priorty ships. She is based from the Type A 1941 Heavy Cruiser "Zao" from [[World of Warships]]

h4. Skins
* !post #6682481: Default
* !post #6703642: [[Unzen (sojourn through clear seas) (azur lane)|Sojourn Through Clear Seas]]

h4. History
It is actually debatable as to whether or not plans for [i]Unzen[/i] actually existed due to the destruction of sensitive information by the IJN prior to surrender. What is known is that a triple 203 mm gun mount, never actually mounted on any Japanese CA, was considered for eight ships planned under the Sixth Naval Armaments Program but no other information has survived. Certain postwar sources such as [i]Japanese Cruisers of the Pacific War[/i] and [i]Uncompleted Fleet Plan - 1917~1950[/i], from where the [i]Unzen[/i]/[i][[Zao (cruiser)|Zaou]][/i] design was based from, are informed guesses.


However, more information surfaces that the Zao-class cruisers are confirmed to be "Type A 1941 Heavy Cruiser" projects in which is derive to the later Mogami and Tone-class cruisers, armed with a Triple 203mm experimental mount and Experimental Torpedo mount.

h4. External links:
"Type A 1941 Heavy Cruiser":[https://wiki.gcdn.co/images/a/a1/Magazine.jpg]

"Type A 1941 CA Design":[https://www.secretprojects.co.uk/proxy.php?image=http%3A%2F%2Fwiki.gcdn.co%2Fimages%2Fb%2Fb7%2FClass_A_1941.jpg&hash=406d1ccf89d1f597f21a132db2fc0373]
